data.text: Panaracer Gravel King SK or Pirelli Cinturato Gravel H?
Looking to snag some new tubeless tires. Iâ€™m down between two different tires. What would be more durable? Panaracer gravel king sk or Pirelli cinturato gravel h?
If you use panaracer gravel king, make sure you use real good sealant. Cause you really gonna need it...
data.author: Bhagavan Rukawa

data.text: really? GravelKing SKs have been nearly indestructible for me. Granted, I roll tubeless so yeah, I use sealant
data.author: Rob Beare

data.text: my typical gravel king tire condition after rides, notice how many wet spots on it.. I got fed up with it and change all out
data.author: Bhagavan Rukawa

data.text: damn....!
data.author: Rob Beare

data.text: I have 2000 miles on a set of GravelKings and while they are quite worn...only once have I ever had any sort of puncture and that was from a rock...never had any seepage or leaking issues. I personally love the GK tires.
data.author: Chad Ashton

data.text: The Pirelli's are stellar
data.author: Garrett Hudson

data.text: Have you ran then?

data.text: Yep. Liked them so much I put some on my wife's bike as well

data.text: I've had a good run on my sks
data.author: Steven Tong

data.text: Maxxis
data.author: Eric Donnell

data.text: GK SKs are good tires. Little hard to seat them. I have front tire with over 2500 miles and still strong. Never needed to add any sealant. Only refresh it every 6 months. I use stans no tube sealant.
data.author: Devinder Singh Bahia

data.text: Pirelliâ€™a are miles better

data.text: Pirelliâ€™s* Got to love spell check. It also depends on your terrain and ride style. I run the Cinturato M 700x40 and 700x45 for bike packing.

data.text: I would choose the Perelli Gravel H over Gravel Kings any day of the week. That said....check out American classic lineup. Nothing but issues with GK SKs and punctures and then punctures not sealing.
data.author: Josh Kebschull

data.text: Have run GK's over varied terrain in TX and VA without a single issue. And hit 40mph on a descent (paved road).
data.author: Brian Slaughter

data.text: You could never give me a gravel King tire ,I had no luck with them

data.text: SKs are greatâ€¦however be warned, they throw small stones on the riders behind you. Lol

data.text: I have the SK + 43â€™s. Not really any issues. Punctured one bad enough itâ€™s now tubed on my spare set.
data.author: Chuck Schneickert

data.text: I heard the SK+ are more resistant to puncture than the regular SK.
data.author: AndrÃ© Lucero

data.text: I'm giving the Pirelli Gravel H a try right now. So far they've worked well. I'd think the Gravel King SS would be a better comparison. The Gravel H's knobs in the center are very shallow in comparison to the SK. And if durability is what you want, be sure to get the SS+ or SK+ if going the Gravel King route. Better durability at the cost of a little more weight and rolling resistance. Heck if puncture durability is your primary motivation... Schwalbe Marathon Plus or Marathon Plus Tour would do the trick, though I don't know if they make a tubeless variant.
data.author: Christopher Burkhart

data.text: I have a set of Pirelli Centurato graven m and they are bomb proof! Donâ€™t understand the hype for the GKâ€™s. I have a set I ran for a few hundred miles. They were not particularly fast nor did they grip that well.

data.text: Riding the Pirellis and great so far. Only downside is on smooth concrete at ~20mph the buzz noise makes it sound like you've got an electric motor. ðŸ˜…

data.text: I had a gravel H blow up on me by running over a small rock at 25mph . I replaced it with a M on the back and so far really like the setup . If my other h goes Iâ€™m gonna buy another M . The M seems more durable for me and my riding style .
